intro: Trinia vulgaris var. dalechampii, commonly known as the common trinia, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to parts of Europe and Asia. It typically grows to a height of 30–60 cm, featuring slender stems and narrow, grass-like leaves. The plant produces small, white or pale pink flowers in late spring to early summer, arranged in clusters at the tips of the stems. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in meadows, woodland edges, and along streambanks. Trinia vulgaris var. dalechampii is valued for its ornamental appeal and ecological benefits, supporting various pollinators.
